task_summary: Detect the green garbage can and lift its hinged lid using a pinch grasp on the lid edge, opening the bin and then retreating.

task_long_description.overview: A mobile manipulator with a parallel gripper must open a green garbage can with a hinged lid visible near a table. The robot approaches from the right, aligns to the lid edge, grasps the edge, lifts it upward to open, verifies the container is open, and retreats to a safe distance. The behavior includes perception fallback scanning, grasp pose computation, and a controlled vertical lift. Constraints include limited timeout bins and small tolerances for alignment.
preconditions: Green garbage can and lid visible within arm reach
Camera provides sufficient view to detect the lid edge
stepwise_plan: Scan and verify visibility of green_can
Detect the can and move near it
Move above and align to lid_edge with tight tolerance
Open gripper and compute grasp pose for lid_edge
Lift along z to raise the lid
Invoke container open primitive and confirm lid state
success_criteria: ContainerOpen condition becomes true for green_can
No collisions with table or bin during motion
failure_and_recovery: If visibility fails, raster scan attempts up to 3 times
If grasp pose missing, abort pick and re-run detection/compute
If pick fails, the sequence halts before lift to prevent dragging
If lid resists opening, timeouts prevent indefinite force application
task_long_description.termination: Tree succeeds when ContainerOpen evaluates true and the robot has retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: lift open green garbage can lid

node_specs.description: Quick check for visual availability of the can before scanning.
Raster scan to locate the green can if not initially visible.
Perceive precise pose of the can/lid area.
Base/arm motion to working distance from the can.
Position tool center slightly above the intended grasp point.
Tight alignment to the lid edge before grasp.
Generate grasp pose for the lid edge and store to blackboard.
Ensure a valid grasp pose exists.
Execute approach and close to grasp the lid edge.
Lift upward to raise the lid.
Explicit container open primitive for robustness.
Back off to a safe distance after opening.

failure_modes: Target not detected due to glare or motion blur
Alignment tolerance not met near table edge
Grasp slips off smooth lid edge
Lid binds against table or bag rim
recovery_strategy: Fallback scan retries detection up to 3 attempts
If pose missing, recompute grasp after re-detecting
Abort lift if grasp unstable; re-open gripper and retry alignment
Timeouts prevent indefinite pushing; retreat and re-approach
assumptions: Green bin with hinged lid as seen in frames; grasping the right-side edge provides leverage to open
No explicit handle present; pinch grasp on edge is feasible
Instruction matches frames; no conflicts observed

expected_success_criteria: Lid clearly raised and ContainerOpen true
